intro: Oncidium reflexum, commonly known as the reflexed orchid, is a species native to Central and South America. It is a perennial herbaceous plant with a complex root system adapted for nutrient absorption in its natural habitat. The plant features strap-like leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, yellowish-green flowers with a distinctive reflexed lip. Oncidium reflexum thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining soil for optimal growth. Its botanical characteristics make it a popular choice for both ornamental and horticultural purposes.
